segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 7. Devatāvagga
segments.en: 7. A God

segments.pli: 69. Devatāsutta
segments.en: 69. A God

segments.pli: Atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “chayime, bhante, dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.

segments.pli: Katame cha?
segments.en: What six?

segments.pli: Satthugāravatā, dhammagāravatā, saṅghagāravatā, sikkhāgāravatā, sovacassatā, kalyāṇamittatā—
segments.en: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training; being easy to admonish, and good friendship.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhante, cha dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.”

segments.pli: Idamavoca sā devatā.
segments.en: That’s what that deity said,

segments.pli: Samanuñño satthā ahosi.
segments.en: and the teacher approved.

segments.pli: Atha kho sā devatā “samanuñño me satthā”ti bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
segments.en: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “imaṃ, bhikkhave, rattiṃ aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, sā devatā maṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: “Tonight, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me, bowed, stood to one side, and said to me:

segments.pli: ‘chayime, bhante, dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: ‘Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.

segments.pli: Katame cha?
segments.en: What six?

segments.pli: Satthugāravatā, dhammagāravatā, saṅghagāravatā, sikkhāgāravatā, sovacassatā, kalyāṇamittatā—
segments.en: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training; being easy to admonish, and good friendship.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhante, cha dhammā bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī’ti.
segments.en: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.’

segments.pli: Idamavoca, bhikkhave, sā devatā.
segments.en: That is what that deity said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyī”ti.
segments.en: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “imassa kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi.
segments.en: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

segments.pli: Idha, bhante, bhikkhu attanā ca satthugāravo hoti satthugāravatāya ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher and praises such respect.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na satthugāravā te ca satthugāravatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū satthugāravā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Attanā ca dhammagāravo hoti …
segments.en: They personally respect the teaching …

segments.pli: saṅghagāravo hoti …
segments.en: They personally respect the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: sikkhāgāravo hoti …
segments.en: They personally respect the training …

segments.pli: suvaco hoti …
segments.en: They are personally easy to admonish …

segments.pli: kalyāṇamitto hoti kalyāṇamittatāya ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na kalyāṇamittā te ca kalyāṇamittatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū kalyāṇamittā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Imassa kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, sāriputta.
segments.en: “Good, good, Sāriputta!

segments.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṃ, sāriputta, imassa mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsi.
segments.en: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.

segments.pli: Idha, sāriputta, bhikkhu attanā ca satthugāravo hoti satthugāravatāya ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher …

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na satthugāravā te ca satthugāravatāya samādapeti.
Ye caññe bhikkhū satthugāravā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
Attanā ca dhammagāravo hoti …
segments.en: They personally respect the teaching …

segments.pli: saṅghagāravo hoti …
segments.en: They personally respect the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: sikkhāgāravo hoti …
segments.en: They personally respect the training …

segments.pli: suvaco hoti …
segments.en: They are personally easy to admonish …

segments.pli: kalyāṇamitto hoti kalyāṇamittatāya ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū na kalyāṇamittā te ca kalyāṇamittatāya samādapeti.
segments.en: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.

segments.pli: Ye caññe bhikkhū kalyāṇamittā tesañca vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Imassa kho, sāriputta, mayā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti.
segments.en: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.

sections.title: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up…

suttaplex.blurb: A god speaks on the factors of non-decline. When the Buddha repeats what he says, Sāriputta gives an explaination.
